title: How Robinhood Cashes In on the Options Boom
sub_head: Brokers can profit more from options than stocks, thanks to payment for order flow
body:
High-speed trading firms are paying brokers billions of dollars a year to execute options orders, leading them to promote the risky trades whose popularity has boomed among small investors.
The practice, called payment for order flow, has made options a cash cow for brokerages such as Robinhood Markets Inc. and TD Ameritrade. They can make twice as much or more from selling customersâ€™ options orders as they do from selling order flow for stocks.
